page.title: 13OAP view of Fintry
page.content: As a girl I lived in a cottage in Old Fintry, by Denny road junction - it's gone now. The school there had closed and we walked the unmetalled road to Fintry Cross where the new one was. I've lived all my life here, for many years in the Main Street and now in this council house. You never locked your door, people just came and went. Life is easier, we have electricity and good roads, but {there used to be more buses on them, {four a day sometimes.}The sanitation scheme is a blessing too, though we lived for years without it. Tv's good entertainment: we made our own - folk can't seem to now. We were never bored, never knew the meaning of the word. Life was simpler, fewer people then, and you knew everyone, but there is no going back. I'd feel happier with our own bobby living here though.
